definitions.definition: The smallest particle of a specific element or compound that retains the chemical properties of that element or compound; two or more atoms held together by chemical bonds .
examples: Hydrogen chloride is a diatomic molecule , consisting of a hydrogen atom and a chlorine atom.

main_definition: ( chemistry ) The smallest particle of a specific element or compound that retains the chemical properties of that element or compound; two or more atoms held together by chemical bonds .
